sen.j: 峰山駅（みねやまえき）は、京都府京丹後市峰山町にある、北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Mineyama-cho of Tango City, Kyoto Prefecture, Mineyama Station is a stop on the Miyazu Line, a Kitakinki Tango Railway Line.
Mineyama Station, located in Mineyama-cho of Tango City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Miyazu Line, a Kitakinki Tango Railway Line.
Mineyama Station, located in Mineyama-cho of Tango City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Miyazu Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway.

sen.j: 峰山は、丹後ちりめんの発祥の地として知られる。
sen.e: Mineyama is well known as the birthplace of Tango chirimen (silk crepe.)
Mineyama is well known as the birthplace of Tango chirimen (silk crepe).
Mineyama is well known as the birthplace of Tango chirimen (silk crepe).

sen.j: また、元南海ホークスの野村克也捕手が在籍していた、京都府立峰山高等学校があることでも知られている。
sen.e: Again, it is also known that Kyoto Prefectural Mineyama High School, the school at which ex-Nankai Hawks catcher Katsuya NOMURA was at one time enrolled, is located in this area.
It is also a well-known fact that Kyoto Prefectural Mineyama High School, the school at which former Nankai Hawks catcher Katsuya NOMURA was at one time enrolled, is located in this area.
It is also a well-known fact that Kyoto Prefectural Mineyama High School, the school at which former Nankai Hawks catcher Katsuya NOMURA was at one time enrolled, is located in this area.

sen.j: 駅構造
島式・相対式2面3線のプラットホームを持つ橋上駅である。
sen.e: It is an over-track station with two platforms, one with the track on one side only and the other an Island type platform with tracks on both sides (one the aforesaid track) for a total of three tracks.

It is an over-track station with two platforms: one with the track on one side only and the other an island-type platform with tracks on both sides (one of which is the aforesaid track), for a total of three tracks.

It is an over-track station with two platforms: one with the track on one side only and the other an island-type platform with tracks on both sides (one of which is the aforesaid track), for a total of three tracks.

sen.j: 駅舎は、丹後ちりめん発祥の地ということで、機織り機をモチーフとしたものとなっている。
sen.e: From Mineyama being the birthplace of Tango chirimen, the station building is designed to depict a weaving machine.
Given Mineyama's distinction as the birthplace of Tango chirimen, the station building is designed to depict a weaving machine.
Given Mineyama's distinction as the birthplace of Tango chirimen, the station building is designed to depict a weaving machine.

sen.j: 駅周辺
京丹後市役所（旧・峰山町役場）
sen.e: Kyotango City Hall (Old Mineyama-cho Town Hall)
Kyotango City Hall (Old Mineyama-cho Town Hall)
Kyotango City Hall (Old Mineyama-cho Town Hall)

sen.j: 峰山杉谷郵便局
京都北都信用金庫峰山支店・峰山中央支店
sen.e: Kyoto Hokuto Shinkin Bank Mineyama Branch・Mineyama-chuo Branch
Kyoto Hokuto Shinkin Bank Mineyama Branch・Mineyama-chuo Branch
Kyoto Hokuto Shinkin Bank Mineyama Branch, Mineyama-chuo Branch

sen.j: 京都銀行峰山支店
京都府立峰山高等学校
ニッポンレンタカー
バス
丹後海陸交通
sen.cmt: 社名が全て大文字である必要はないと思われます。

sen.j: 溝谷（弥栄病院前）・網野駅前・間人（たいざ）方面行き
sen.e: For: Mizotani (Yasaka-byoin-mae (Yasaka Hospital)), Amino-eki-mae (Amino Station), Taiza

sen.j: 上宮津・与謝の海病院方面行き
久美浜駅前行き
タクシー
峰山タクシー
丹和タクシー
利用状況
2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約370人である。
sen.e: Number of passengers getting on at this station in fiscal 2006 was approximately 370 per day.
sen.cmt: "約"は"平均"が適切？。その場合、”was approximately”は"averaged"になります。
sen.e: The number of passengers getting on at this station in fiscal 2006 amounted to approximately 370 per day.
The number of passengers boarding at this station came to approximately 370 per day in fiscal year 2006.

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
歴史
1925年（大正14年）11月3日 - 日本国有鉄道峰山線が当駅まで延長され、開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated Nov. 3, 1925 from Japanese National Railways Mineyama Line being extended to this station.
It was inaugurated Nov. 3, 1925, consequent upon the extension of the Japanese National Railway's Mineyama Line to this station.
November 3, 1925: The station was inaugurated consequent upon the extension of the Japan National Railway's Mineyama Line to this station.

sen.j: 1926年（昭和元年）12月25日 - 国鉄峰豊線峰山～網野間が開業。
sen.e: The Mineyama-Amino section of Japanese National Railways Minetoyo Line commenced operations on Dec. 25, 1926.
The Mineyama-Amino section of Japanese National Railways Minetoyo Line commenced operations on Dec. 25, 1926.
December 25, 1926: The Mineyama-Amino section of Japan National Railways Minetoyo Line commenced operations.

sen.j: 1932年（昭和7年）8月10日 - 峰山線・峰豊線を宮津線に改称。
sen.e: Mineyama Line and Minetoyo Line jointly renamed Miyazu Line on Aug. 10, 1932.
The Mineyama and Minetoyo lines were jointly renamed the Miyazu Line on Aug. 10, 1932.
August 10, 1932: The Mineyama and Minetoyo lines were jointly renamed the Miyazu Line.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 from split privatization of Japan National Railways.
It became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 from split privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The station became a JR West station due to the split privatization of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）4月1日 - 北近畿タンゴ鉄道への宮津線移管により、同鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a station of Kitakinki Tango Railway incidental to transfer of control of Miyazu Line to it on April 1, 1990.
It became a station of Kitakinki Tango Railway incidental to the transfer of control of Miyazu Line to it on April 1, 1990.
April 1, 1990: The station became a station of Kitakinki Tango Railway incidental to the transfer of control of Miyazu Line to it.

sen.j: 隣の駅
北近畿タンゴ鉄道
宮津線
丹後大宮駅 - 峰山駅 - 網野駅
sen.e: Tango-Omiya Station - Mineyama Station - Amino Station
Tango-Omiya Station - Mineyama Station - Amino Station
Tango-Omiya Station - Mineyama Station - Amino Station
